message: fix(curriculum): updated how to set keyboard Spanish article (#64526)

files.patch:
@@ -22,38 +22,39 @@ The simplest way to type accented letters is by pressing and holding the letter
 
 This is perfect when you only need accents occasionally. 
 
-
 ## Adding Language Keyboards  
 
 Another alternative would be adding a Spanish keyboard layout, which can be helpful to have quicker access to accents and other characters.
 
 ### On Android  
 
-1. Open **Settings**.
+**NOTE:** The Android path is not universal and may vary depending on the device.
 
-2. Go to **System > Keyboard > On-screen keyboard**.
+1. Open Settings.
 
-3. Choose your keyboard app, like Gboard.
+2. Go to System (or General Management, depending on the device). 
 
-4. Tap **Languages**.
+3. Tap Keyboard settings (or Languages & input).  
 
-5. Add Spanish.
+4. Tap Languages and types (or Add keyboard). 
 
-6. Tap **Done** to finish.
+5. Select Spanish (US), or tap Manage input languages and choose Spanish (US).  
 
+6. Save or tap Done, if prompted.
 
-### On iPhone  
+### On iPhone
 
-1. Open **Settings**.
+1. Open Settings.  
 
-2. Go to **General > Keyboard**.
+2. Go to General > Keyboard. 
 
-3. Tap **Keyboards**, then **Add New Keyboard**.
+3. Tap Keyboards.  
 
-4. Select Spanish.
+4. Tap Add New Keyboard.  
 
-5. Use the globe icon on your keyboard to switch between language layouts.
+5. Select Spanish (Latin America).
 
+6. Use the globe icon on the keyboard to switch languages.
 
 ## Third-Party Keyboards
